author: timgraham
message: Fixed #18490 - Updated DateField input formats; thanks dloewenherz for the draft patch.

files.patch:
@@ -398,11 +398,21 @@ For each field, we describe the default widget used if you don't specify
 
     If no ``input_formats`` argument is provided, the default input formats are::
 
-        '%Y-%m-%d', '%m/%d/%Y', '%m/%d/%y', # '2006-10-25', '10/25/2006', '10/25/06'
-        '%b %d %Y', '%b %d, %Y',            # 'Oct 25 2006', 'Oct 25, 2006'
-        '%d %b %Y', '%d %b, %Y',            # '25 Oct 2006', '25 Oct, 2006'
-        '%B %d %Y', '%B %d, %Y',            # 'October 25 2006', 'October 25, 2006'
-        '%d %B %Y', '%d %B, %Y',            # '25 October 2006', '25 October, 2006'
+        '%Y-%m-%d',       # '2006-10-25'
+        '%m/%d/%Y',       # '10/25/2006'
+        '%m/%d/%y',       # '10/25/06'
+
+    Additionally, if you specify :setting:`USE_L10N=False<USE_L10N>` in your settings, the
+    following will also be included in the default input formats::
+
+        '%b %m %d',       # 'Oct 25 2006'
+        '%b %d, %Y',      # 'Oct 25, 2006'
+        '%d %b %Y',       # '25 Oct 2006'
+        '%d %b, %Y',      # '25 Oct, 2006'
+        '%B %d %Y',       # 'October 25 2006'
+        '%B %d, %Y',      # 'October 25, 2006'
+        '%d %B %Y',       # '25 October 2006'
+        '%d %B, %Y',      # '25 October, 2006'
 
 ``DateTimeField``
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
